definition: to divide/to separate/to distribute/to allocate/to distinguish (good and bad)/part or subdivision/fraction/one tenth (of certain units)/unit of length equivalent to 0.33 cm/minute (unit of time)/minute (angular measurement unit)/a point (in sports or games)/0.01 yuan (unit of money)
person representing the dead (during burial ceremonies)/to put a corpse on display (after execution)/variant of 屍|尸[shi1]/corpse

sentences.english: It's hard enough tokill him, but it's very hard to spile him, sir.
sentences.chinese: 杀了他就够厉害的，分尸太过分了，先生。

sentences.english: It's hard enough to kill him, but it's very hard to split him, sir. '
sentences.chinese: 杀了他就够厉害的，分尸太过分了，先生。

definition: to dismember/(fig.) to break into parts
to hack to death/to kill with an ax
to die tragically/to meet with a violent death
the lingering death/the death of a thousand cuts (old form of capital punishment)
to skin/to flay/to excoriate/to peel/to bark at sb/to physically punish sb
same as 剝皮|剥皮[bao1 pi2]
to make mincemeat of sb/to hack sb to pieces (used while cursing)
